summary: Seasoned and adaptable full-stack software engineer, with extensive experience in backend development, devops and agile project management.

achievements.description: Implemented migration of the core Ruby on Rails application from Heroku to Kubernetes on AWS and managed project requirements, expectations and progress with stakeholders and consultants. Performed management and troubleshooting of Kubernetes clusters using Terraform and Kops across multiple AWS accounts.
Configured continuous integration and continuous delivery pipelines in Codefresh, using Docker compositions for test suites and Helm charts for deployment to Kubernetes clusters.

Provided engineering leadership to drive process improvements, including implementing a Kanban process for the engineering team to more adeptly shift with product requirement and priority changes. Created issue tracking boards, workflows and reports in JIRA to support and communicate our process as it evolved.
Performed code reviews and architectural and design reviews, and mentored junior developers.

Provide technical leadership and management of day-to-day tasks for a small team of engineers chartered to monitor and improve the performance of Spokeo's website, including server response time,  client-side rendering, and everything in between. Worked closely with DevOps, QA, Product Management, and other engineering teams to continuously deliver performance improvements to the Spokeo web app stack.

Architected and implemented a highly-performant, scalable Node.js HTTP caching service that stores billions of HTML documents and serves the first byte within 40ms. In a context where every millisecond can have vast consequences, this cost-effective solution brought real-world response times of over 300ms down near 100ms, and was the subject of an AWS re:Invent 2016 Case Study ("Spokeo Improved Web Application Response Times with EFS (STG206)").

Developed services and designed infrastructure to populate and manage the HTTP cache. With billions of HTML documents to render and store, these services drive fleets of Ruby on Rails applications to render web pages at rates over 600,000 requests/sec, and utilize AWS EC2 Spot Fleets to minimize costs. Needing to optimize for every millisecond, this project also required monitoring and identifying bottlenecks in all services involved downstream, including Ruby on Rails applications, MySQL/Aurora databases, ElasticSearch clusters, and DynamoDB tables.
Designed, implemented, and launched a prototype HTTP caching layer using a CDN to provide fast response times of SEO pages for search engine crawlers.
Full-stack development of new features for the Spokeo consumer website.
Helped develop new Agile SDLCs for Spokeo's growing engineering teams, and managed the technical aspects of migrating issue tracking and wiki content to Atlassian JIRA and Confluence.

Managed an agile team of six developers to provide development resources to the Production Operations group, which is responsible for all applications once they are released from QA to production. The team was responsible for a growing, diverse portfolio of over two dozen highly available services ranging from live application monitoring to issue tracking and source control.

Led the development of a system that combined data from separate hardware, software and network device inventories into a centralized service to map, visualize and report on operational dependencies for change management and incident management. Implemented the web UI using AngularJS, atop a stack with a Sinatra web application and a Neo4j graph database.
Developed web applications integrated with ActiveDirectory to allow corporate users to self-provision phone numbers and fax numbers.
Developed a web application integrated with the JIRA issue tracker to simplify the process of requesting IT support.
Created a wallboard to display live web application performance metrics for the network operations center.
Formalized and implemented a software development cycle where there previously was none.

Developed Java and JavaScript plugins for Atlassian platform products, such as JIRA and Confluence. The plugins added automation to decrease clicks and time required for administrators to perform repetitive and error-prone tasks, as well as making the UI’s more informative for users within the company.
Improved performance of the company’s JIRA and Confluence installations by 100% by performing performance profiling, identifying heavy usage patterns, and deploying on more appropriate hardware.

experiences.company_profile: 2010 Red Herring 100 North America award winner was the leading provider of self-service order and payment systems for the Quick Service Restaurant and Fast Casual Dining industries.

achievements.description: Led design and implementation of a service to replicate Salesforce data to a local database server for consumption by internal applications. The system involved retrieving data from the Salesforce web service API, dynamically creating new Hibernate mappings, generating new POJO classes and deploying them to Tomcat web applications.

Implemented the server-side components, in Java, for a kiosk reporting system that provided near real-time status of remotely deployed kiosks. The kiosk monitoring system was pivotal to gaining a major fast food brand’s full acceptance of the OrderM8 kiosk solution for their restaurants.
Filled the role of lead administrator and developer for JIRA. Initiated workflow and process changes, and developed JIRA plugins to improve software development business processes.
Created a Java desktop application to automate quality control testing of kiosk hardware devices, reducing the number of kiosks deployed with faulty devices.
Developed a digital menu board prototype that became a centerpiece of the company’s showroom, and displayed for all visiting executives from client companies.
Led a team of up to six data technicians and acted as a liaison to the Software Development Department, along with increased involvement in core software development
Implemented device drivers in Java for new coin dispenser hardware for the OrderM8 self-service kiosk.

Designed and developed a client-facing ASP.NET web application for clients to create and track change requests for their kiosk menus, improving department efficiency by centralizing information which was previously tracked by e-mail and phone.

Created a Java SWT application to visualize and manage kiosk menu data. Previously, all data was managed by hand, using SQL queries. The application was showcased at trade shows and was presented to potential clients.
Designed and developed an ASP.NET web application for internal use to track projects and work items.
Created internal software tools to automate and/or increase the efficiency of tasks related to managing kiosk menu data.

positions.title: Web Intern
positions.department: Web Team, Department of Information Technology and Communications

achievements.description: Designed and developed an intranet web application for job tracking and workflow of web projects.
Web Team received one of four “Top Pick for 2003” web site awards from MuniNet Guide for large cities.
Web Team received San Diego City Council recognition for greater than 90% satisfaction ratings from citizen surveys.
